metadata.synopsis: The dapper drow intimacy scene. Used for all cases (drow male, female, both with companions + possibly Halsin).
metadata.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Sharess Caressfor singular branches: hire one of the drow, otherwise -hire both drow (you need to have a romanced companion or Astarion/Halsin with you), proceed to the room

57.speaker: Nym Orlith
57.text: That was wonderful. Perhaps you'll enjoy a drink in the bar before you brave the streets again.

105.speaker: Nym Orlith
105.text: Quite the merry little party we have assembled here.

193.speaker: Sorn Orlith
193.text: In Qu'ellarz'orl custom from our home, groups of five or more meet quorum to qualify as 'orgies'.

182.speaker: Sorn Orlith
182.text: Four or fewer are simply a gathering. Legally speaking, at least.

273.speaker: Nym Orlith
273.text: I hope you're not afraid of the dark, my darling. I must snuff out the lights before we begin.

241.text: *You feel the vision granted to you by Shar dull. This is not the kind of darkness the Lady cares for.*

238.speaker: Narrator
238.text: *You feel the vision granted to you by Shar dull. This is not the kind of darkness the Lady cares for.*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *The lady, Nym, moves your hand to where the clasps of her blouse lie.*

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: All right sweethearts. You dare to dance with a professional, you'll get your desire.

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *His skin is like lustred pearls, almost translucent and so delicately smooth.*

179.speaker: Sorn Orlith
179.text: He's so perfect, it could move even the toughest soul to tears.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: Hmm. Nature used all of its powers when it sculpted you, Astarion.

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *It's so easy to see why that body alone ruined so many lives.*

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: You're looking at me rather curiously. Speak up, tell us what you want to do.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: You don't need to wait for my command. Do what you wish.

166.speaker: Astarion
166.text: I wish... to drink. And to be drunk.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Sometimes when I see how beautiful you are, I'm just dumbfounded.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Only making sure you're all right.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: My fair consort, I can't wait to dine upon this four-course meal with you.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: I don't know if we should...

195.speaker: Astarion
195.text: Just a figure of speech. I promise not to bite down to the bone.

25.speaker: Sorn Orlith
25.text: Pah! Fake. I pretend to be a vampire before my clients all the time, and I bite twice as hard. Wait... hhnhng.

101.speaker: Halsin
101.text: Ha - tickles. See what a bad influence you are, Astarion?

201.speaker: Astarion
201.text: You haven't earned the right to stare at me like that.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Big talk coming from you, who always wants to eat me.

230.speaker: Astarion
230.text: I can't help myself - you look so delicious.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: Well, if you don't want my attention, there are several other beautiful elves here.

251.speaker: Astarion
251.text: I hope you like a kiss with teeth, druid.

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: As long as you like to be caressed by claws, Astarion.

29.speaker: Sorn Orlith
29.text: For this, I feel we should be paying you.

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Astarion boldly throws himself into the centre of attention in your little group, and all lavish their pleasures on him.*

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *But as you sit on his lap, resting afterwards, you look into his eyes, and see no trace of joy. Just an intensity that makes you shiver.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Astarion lavishes attentions on everyone present with flawless technique, unfazed. It's all pure instinct.*

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *But when you meet his eye for a moment, there's a look about him that reveals he's a million realms away.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *As soon as you begin, you hear a zap of magic over from where Gale last was.*
65.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *With a scamper, he is gone from the room, and in his place is -*

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: Hello! I'm here on behalf of Gale of Waterdeep to participate in this evening's activities. He would like me to assure you all that I am anatomically accurate.

140.speaker: Halsin
140.text: Pity. A magical surrogate is no equal to nature's true creation.

10.speaker: Sorn Orlith
10.text: Fear not - there are still many things we can do with you.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I was hoping you'd get involved, Gale.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: I am involved! I'm taking notes. Making observations.

192.speaker: Halsin
192.text: Then I hope you are apt with shorthand, wizard. There will be much to observe.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: It's all right if you only wish to watch.

186.speaker: Halsin
186.text: Hmm. Hovering yonder like a carrion bird. Perhaps he'll find the courage to peck at some flesh later.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Halsin! Pin me against the wall.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *The drow gasp as Halsin raises you up, your legs catching on his hips, as he clasps you close to his pelvis.*

158.speaker: Halsin
158.text: Don't just stare, Gale. That mouth of yours can do better than just hang open, I'll wager.

315.speaker: Gale
315.text: I'll enjoy myself well enough from back here! You go on and do... the rutting or what have you.

306.speaker: Narrator
306.text: *As you enjoy yourself with the drow, the image of Gale tuts disapprovingly, but the orb in his naked chest glows with telltale excitement.*

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: You know, I had a dream just like this once.
133.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

207.speaker: Halsin
207.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: You were in it, so it was certainly... lively.
52.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

235.speaker: Nym Orlith
235.text: I'm surprised you needed the two of us for this to happen, but I am so glad it has.
235.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

37.speaker: Sorn Orlith
37.text: Oh, empyrean high priestess, let us worship at your altar!
37.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *The drow siblings fall to their knees in mock-prayer towards Shadowheart, lavishing caresses over her thighs.*
143.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

268.speaker: Halsin
268.text: My. And to think some shun organised religion...
268.context: NodeContext: Lightheartedly aroused and taken aback

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Empress of my desires, you shall be revered on this eve!

254.speaker: Shadowheart
254.text: I could get used to this...

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I thought you didn't want to lead a religious order, Shadowheart.

335.speaker: Shadowheart
335.text: I can compromise... just this once.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Oh, I'm going to destroy the Shar Temple tonight.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: Free of Shar, and now you have worshippers of your own. You must be pleased.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: I'd be more pleased if you joined them...

134.speaker: Halsin
134.text: To watch a woman flush with pleasure is one of nature's sweetest gifts... though perhaps you will prove even sweeter, Shadowheart...

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *The night skips on, filled with fantasies Shadowheart seemed all too primed to suggest.*

323.speaker: Sorn Orlith
323.text: I can't quite believe it - a night of passion with the famous Halsin? I might faint before I can expend myself.

245.speaker: Nym Orlith
245.text: Legends spread of you throughout the city... We heard tell that you can change into a bear.

247.speaker: Halsin
247.text: I hadn't realised I was that popular.
247.context: CinematicNodeContext: Roaring sound effect after Halsin's line.

329.speaker: Halsin
329.text: But we must give the people what they want, mustn't we?
329.context: CinematicNodeContext: Roaring sound effect after Halsin's line.

248.speaker: Sorn Orlith
248.text: Will tonight at last be the night I die during an act of pleasure?

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: Very well... I wouldn't wish to risk damaging the room, I suppose.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: You're both cowards! We do this all the time.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cine node where the player, the two drow, your companions, and Halsin as a bear are all cuddling each other.

54.speaker: Sorn Orlith
54.text: You're a straight liar. I know this sort of matter requires days of recovery between sessions.

63.speaker: Nym Orlith
63.text: Doesn't it...? How does it even fit?

160.speaker: Player
160.text: It doesn't. But Halsin can be quite a fine healer.

293.speaker: Player
293.text: We don't do that when he's a bear!

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Jump atop Halsin and ride him around the room.
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cine node where the player, the two drow, your companions, and Halsin as a bear are all cuddling each other.

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *Fur tickles your bare nethers as the two drow scream in terror and delight.*
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cine node where the player, the two drow, your companions, and Halsin as a bear are all cuddling each other.

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *The drow are filled with awe at your and Halsin's habits throughout the night, time and time again.*
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cine node where the player, the two drow, your companions, and Halsin as a bear are all cuddling each other.

337.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cine node where the player, the two drow, your companions, and Halsin as a bear are all cuddling each other.

342.speaker: Narrator
342.text: *You feel your Devil's Sight dull. Your Patron really doesn't want to see this.*

274.speaker: Narrator
274.text: *Though you have the power to see in the dark, in the face of lust, you can't help but close your eyes...*

290.speaker: Player
290.text: Murmur a quick prayer under your breath that this doesn't break into a brawl.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: These affairs always sound better in theory. Let's not, after all.

68.speaker: Nym Orlith
68.text: Understood. No pressure, my love. These things are not for everyone. Come back if you change your mind.

118.speaker: Nym Orlith
118.text: We recover quickly. But not that quickly.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: Is there anything else I should know of this place?

41.speaker: Nym Orlith
41.text: Even in the best of times, it's an oasis of pleasure and calm in the city's chaos.

71.speaker: Nym Orlith
71.text: With Baldur's Gate preparing for war, the Caress feels like the final flicker of a beautiful flame before darkness falls.

213.speaker: Nym Orlith
213.text: You came! I'm so pleased. You can never tell who's going to get cold feet.
213.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

304.speaker: Nym Orlith
304.text: No offence meant, of course - I know cold feet comes with the scales.
304.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

173.speaker: Nym Orlith
173.text: So, now that you're here... what next?
173.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

257.speaker: Player
257.text: I came here to talk, that's all.
257.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

298.speaker: Nym Orlith
298.text: Of course. Perhaps there is something you want to tell me, that you can't talk to anyone else about?

14.speaker: Nym Orlith
14.text: It won't go beyond this room. I probably cannot help, but maybe it will comfort you if there is someone to listen?

291.speaker: Player
291.text: I shouldn't burden you with my woes. That isn't your job.

313.speaker: Nym Orlith
313.text: My job is to spend time in your company, in whatever way will leave you feeling fulfilled.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Can we talk about something less heavy? Tell me a story.

217.speaker: Narrator
217.text: *She elects to tell you a story of when she left the Underdark, and how afraid she was of the sun at first.*

299.speaker: Narrator
299.text: *She tells her tale with such sweet sincerity, often getting sidetracked and going down on burrowing tangents. You become enwrapped in her words for several hours.*

92.speaker: Player
92.text: My people are in conflict, and I don't know whose words to trust.

282.speaker: Narrator
282.text: *Catharsis falls over you as you pour out your heart for hours.*

302.speaker: Player
302.text: I've been called a hero. I'm not so sure I'm worthy of the title.

316.speaker: Player
316.text: Tell her about the machine in your chest. About how there's nothing you can do to stop it from burning you from the inside out.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: There's nothing alluring about pain - I've had my fill of it already, and then some.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Tell her about the years of loneliness and fear you felt living under Cazador.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I'm the literal child of the god of murder, and it is a bit much some days.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I'm still wholly in love with my lost lover...

239.speaker: Player
239.text: The Underdark was terrible, but I miss it dearly.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: People treat me like a big lump of meat sometimes.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I can't take it when my jokes fall flat. Every awkward silence haunts me at night.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: Sometimes under my robes... I don't wear smallclothes.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I'm so lonely... I don't really know where I went wrong in love.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: Trying to balance multiple partners has been such a shift, and a challenge.

210.speaker: Player
210.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

294.speaker: Nym Orlith
294.text: An experience no one else here will give you. A chance to be embraced in the dark, but what that means is up to you.
294.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

147.speaker: Nym Orlith
147.text: And, of course, there's no charge. Anything for someone who helped find Ffion.
147.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

122.speaker: Nym Orlith
122.text: So what can I do for you?
122.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile, esp. "Wonderful"

325.speaker: Nym Orlith
325.text: A tender touch? Some sensory stimulation?

139.speaker: Player

188.speaker: Nym Orlith

6.speaker: Nym Orlith

305.speaker: Nym Orlith

319.speaker: Player

125.speaker: Nym Orlith

281.speaker: Player

0.speaker: Player

132.speaker: Nym Orlith
132.text: Thanks for confiding in me. I won't do that. Now...

102.speaker: Player

59.speaker: Player

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Er, if you ask me to choke you, I might not stop.

328.speaker: Player

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Keep me on top. I get a bit anxious if a larger person is above me.

90.speaker: Player

327.speaker: Player

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'd just like to spend an hour without experiencing a height joke.

30.speaker: Player

99.speaker: Player

130.speaker: Sorn Orlith

310.speaker: Sorn Orlith

40.speaker: Sorn Orlith
